abstract: Egyptian court sentences two police officers to seven years in prison for the beating death of 28-year-old Khaled Said, whose killing helped set of the Egyptian revolution; sentence angers both Said's family, who say it is too lenient, and relatives of the police officers.
snippet: Supporters of Khaled Said said the seven-year sentence of the police officers responsible for his death was evidence that Egypt’s ruling military council was not committed to democratic changes.
lead_paragraph: Supporters of Khaled Said said the seven-year sentence of the police officers responsible for his death was evidence that Egypt’s ruling military council was not committed to democratic changes.

headline.main: Officers Get 7 Years for Killing That Helped Inspire Egypt’s Revolt
headline.print_headline: Officers Get 7 Years for Killing That Helped Inspire Egypt’s Revolt
headline.seo: Khaled Said’s Killing Draws 7-Year Sentences for 2 Officers
